title: Families Try Making Up After Pandemic Fights Over Vaccines, Masks and Tests
sub_head: Covid-19 brought some families together and divided others. As case counts fall, many people want a fresh start but are unsure how to begin.
body:
Disagreements over Covid-19 have divided families in ways that could outlast the pandemic, though many are trying to address them.
Andy Siegel and Caryn Hanrahan had their first pandemic-related blowup in 2020 during a family beach vacation, which ended with half the family leaving. They have since argued about haircuts, football games and vaccine mandates.
